Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge correctly applied the residency requirement under s. 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant was present in Canada for only 584 days during the four years preceding the application, falling short of the required 1,095 days
Decision_Outcome: Appeal dismissed; Citizenship Judge's decision upheld
Court_Ruling: The Citizenship Judge correctly applied the physical presence test
Defendant_Behavior: Failed to meet the statutory physical residency requirement
Grounds_for_Claim: Applicant argued that the physical presence test should not have been applied without justification
Legal_Standard: Physical presence test (quantitative approach) is the correct interpretation of s. 5(1)(c)
Assessment_Factor: Number of days physically present in Canada
Procedural_Issue: Appeal based on the record before the Citizenship Judge, governed by Federal Courts Rules
Review_Standard: Statutory interpretation and case law comparison
Evidence_Used: Evidence of applicant's establishment in Canada
Application_Basis: Failure to meet 1,095-day physical residency requirement
Evidence_Assessed: Duration of physical presence in Canada, ties to Canada
Governing_Rule: Under s. 5(1)(c), applicants must be physically present in Canada for at least 1,095 days in the four years preceding the application
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient days of physical presence (only 584 days)
Cause_Description: Applicant challenged the Citizenship Judge's application of the physical presence test without requiring justification
Evidence_Handling: Considered evidence of applicantâ€™s establishment in Canada but found insufficient to meet residency requirement
Evidence_Issues: Lack of sufficient documentation or proof of physical presence
Evidence_Assessment: Physical presence test applied; evidence showed insufficient days in Canada
Decision_Rationale: The physical presence test is the correct interpretation; no obligation to justify its use over other tests
Evidentiary_Issues: Applicant failed to provide sufficient evidence of required residency duration
